ncei_access package¶

Submodules¶

ncei_access.exceptions module¶

exception ncei_access.exceptions.NceiAccessException¶

Bases: Exception

idk.

ncei_access.models module¶

Classes that organize the outputs of functions into defined objects.

class ncei_access.models.Result(status_code: int, message: str = '', data: List[Dict] = None)¶

Bases: object

The formatted version of what we get back from the low level request.get()

Parameters:

  • status_code – Standard HTTP Status code

  • message – Human readable result, defaults to “”

  • data – dict or list of dicts, defaults to None

class ncei_access.models.Station(name: str = '', station_id: str = '', lat: float = 0.0, lon: float = 0.0, data_types: list = None)¶

Bases: object

Class representing a weather station with all the details. It’s the returned object from the find_station function

Parameters:

  • name – Name of station

  • station_id – NCEI/NOAA? ID for station

  • lat – Latitude of station. Decimal format.

  • lon – Longitude of station. Decimal format.

  • dataTypes – Dict of dataTypes reported with a tuple for each (startDate, endDate)

distance_to(lat: float, lon: float) → float¶

Calculate distance to provided coordinates from station using the haversine formula.

Parameters:

  • lat – Latitude (decimal format)

  • lon – Longitude (decimal format)

Returns:

Distance in kilometers.

has_data_type(data_type: str, start_date: str = None, end_date: str = None) → bool¶

Return true if data_type of interest is recorded at station and if optional start and/or end dates are passed, return true if period of record for data_type is equal to or excedes start and/or end dates. Return false otherwise.

Parameters:

  • data_type – dataType of interest

  • start_date – data_type records should begin on or before start_date, defaults to None

  • end_date – data_type records should end on or after end_date, defaults to None

Returns:

boolean

ncei_access.ncei_accessor module¶

Main class for accessing NCEI Access API.

class ncei_access.ncei_accessor.NceiAccessor(logger: Logger = None)¶

Bases: object

High level class to interact with NCEI Access API.

find_closest_station(lat, lon, data_type: str = '', start_date: str = '', end_date: str = '') → Station¶

Find closest station to provided coordinates.

Parameters:

  • lat – Latitude (decimal format)

  • lon – Longitude (decimal format)

  • data_type – Optional data type to filter stations by.

  • start_date – Optional start date to filter stations by.

  • end_date – Optional end date to filter stations by.

Returns:

Station object containing name, station_id, lat, lon.

find_station(station_id: str) → Station¶

Get a station by its ID.

Parameters:

station_id – NCEI/NOAA? ID for station

Returns:

Station object with name, station_id, lat, lon, and data_types.

get_daily(data_types: str | List[str], stations: str | List[str], start: str = '2024-04-21', end: str = '2025-04-21') → Result¶

Obtain daily data from user specified stations (or just a single station) over the specified period of interest.

Parameters:

  • data_types – data type(s) of interest. Can be a single string or a list of strings. See ncei_access.dataType_ref for available data types.

  • stations – station id. Obtained from find_station function.

  • start – beginning date of period of interest. See NCEI Access documentation for string format, defaults to “2024-04-21”

  • end – end date of period of interest. See NCEI Access documentation for string format, defaults to “2025-04-21”

Returns:

Daily highs and lows from station requested.

get_daily_hilow(stations, start: str = '2024-04-21', end: str = '2025-04-21') → Result¶

Obtain daily high and low temperatures from one user specified station over period of interest. For convenience, this is a wrapper around get_daily.

Parameters:

  • stations – station id. Obtained from find_station function.

  • start – beginning date of period of interest. See NCEI Access documentation for string format, defaults to “2024-04-21”

  • end – end date of period of interest. See NCEI Access documentation for string format, defaults to “2025-04-21”

Returns:

Daily highs and lows from station requested.

stations_in_boundary(north: float, west: float, south: float, east: float) → list¶

Find all stations within bounds that have at least some data within the last 100 days.

Parameters:

  • lat_N – _description_

  • lon_W – _description_

  • lat_S – _description_

  • lat_E – _description_

Returns:

list of stations

ncei_access.rest_adapter module¶

Low level components of NCEI Access API wrapper.

class ncei_access.rest_adapter.RestAdapter(hostname: str = 'www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/services', logger: Logger = None)¶

Bases: object

Low level tool for accessing API.

Parameters:

  • hostname – Normally, www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/services, defaults to “www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/services”

  • ver – Currectly only v1, defaults to “v1”

  • logger – (optional) If your app has a logger, pass it in here. Defaults to None

get(endpoint: str = 'data/v1/', ep_params: Dict = None) → Result¶

Fundamental function for getting data.

Parameters:

  • endpoint – 4 options: - “data/v1” for getting data. - “search/v1/data” for searching for stations or dataTypes. - “support/v3/datasets” to discover metadata about datasets. - “orders/v1” to retrieve information about previous orders. Idk.

  • ep_params – parameters for API call, defaults to None

Raises:

  • NceiAccessException – _description_

  • NceiAccessException – _description_

  • NceiAccessException – _description_

Returns:

_description_

Module contents¶

Just creating the dataType_ref object here for convenience later.
